reviewText: It is an interesting look into a small, wholesome circus.  Not interesting enough to binge watch.  There is a nice cross section of characters.  The first couple of episodes included workers with fake names (in my day, "Frenchy" was the popular one we joked about which gave it some credibility.  It is at times suspenseful (will the act be cut--can they do those catches?) to keep it from being mundane.
Title: Circus

reviewText: I wish I could have seen the circus in person the year this documentary was made.  I would happily have bought a ticket.  Too bad they don't let the show run a couple of years.  They let the clown (dancing in the rain) and the clown who led the orchestra with children go. I hope they have found other jobs. Grandma is still there, and (s)he's a staple of The Big Apple Circus.  So much fun and talent!  I was interested to see how the people behind the scenes live, too.  The workers have a pitiful life that they make for themselves.  The show gives them lodging and food and a small salary.  Two of the women struck me as being very intelligent except in their choice of men.  If you like the circus and, for the most part, I do you will probably enjoy this series.
Title: Circus

reviewText: A series that takes you behind the scene and shows the way the Big Apple Circus deals with day to day operation.
Title: Circus

reviewText: I always wanted to more about this circus. from what I saw and heard! its a tough show to get into. I never hade a change to see it. but from this presentation. I would like to. I enjoyed. (thanks)
Title: Circus

reviewerName: John S. Harris "The Voice of Reason"
reviewText: This is as entertaining and gripping as any other "backstage drama" movie or program you've ever seen.  This program devotes almost equal time to the crew and creative team as it does to the performers, and the program is that much more well-rounded and informative because of it.This program examines circus life both for its glamour and for its warts.  It truly is a unique lifestyle for everyone involved and it makes them a VERY tight-knit family.  Most of us should be so lucky as to have a family like this.Highly recommended program.  I watched all six episodes (running a total of just over 5.5 hours) in one sitting.  I just couldn't help myself:  I got caught up in the love of the lifestyle and the joy of this segment of showbiz.Do whatever you have to do to watch this.
summary: I watched all six hours of it in one sitting.  That's how engaging this documentary is!
Title: Circus

reviewText: Produced and televised originally on PBS stations, "Circus" is an all-encompassing six part documentary that takes you behind the scenes of the famed "Big Apple Circus." From rehearsals to the end of the season, this exhaustive documentary really puts you into the hearts and minds of the individuals dedicating their lives to the show. While I can't say that I'm a huge circus fan, I did find "Circus" to be a highly entertaining piece. More concerned with the personalities that populate the circus community, "Circus" is far more interested in exposing the drama "in the life" than "under the big top." In other words, while you do see plenty of awesome acts, most of the film takes place outside of the staged performances.The film starts in training and rehearsals, and the first two episodes are arguably its strongest. Introducing the acts and the backstage personnel, we get an intimate look at both the creative and practical challenges that face such a huge endeavor. The colorful cast includes a struggling first year clown, estranged identical twin brother jugglers, a trapeze act that may not make it, a roadie taken off for creating a bomb scare, a high wire artiste whose act may be too urbane, a circus institution battling cancer, and a new guest creative director. We also meet the founders and see the stewardship of the circus transfer hands. There are lots of stories going on--unexpected firings, romance in laborer ranks, injuries and insecurities. "Circus" makes an interesting microcosm of society on the fringes and works well making the viewers understand and care about its inhabitants.Ultimately, I feel the momentum does wane a bit in the final three episodes. There is less inherent drama once the circus is established and on the road. But I did like the humanizing touches, especially as the season winds down leaving the fate of many of the performers open ended. Perhaps the most successful element at the end is to see one circus kid graduate the trailer school with his high school diploma to set out for college. The circus life is messy and often times you are born to it--in fact, those choosing it are often seen as outsiders by those whose families have been in the act for generations. I was entertained by "Circus" and enjoyed it immensely. If you have an interest in the circus, this recommendation is a no-brainer. But I'd say this is good stuff for anyone that likes real human interest material as well. KGHarris, 11/10.
summary: A Six Part Documentary--This Circus Has One Big Top But Plenty Of Personal Drama
Title: Circus

reviewText: Circus is an extraordinary DVD documentary of the annual 350-show, town-to-town tour of the Big Apple Circus. From seventh and eighth-generation circus performers, to newcomers looking to earn their place in the spotlight, to the crushing effects of an economy turning sour, Circus is a behind-the-scenes look at the ups and downs of this incredible entertainment industry. Special features include character profiles, bonus footage of circus daily life, and more. An absolute "must-have" for anyone who has ever wondered what life as a circus member is truly like, highly recommended especially for public library collections. 3 discs, 6 hours, widescreen, subtitles.
summary: Highly recommended especially for public library collections
Title: Circus

reviewText: ...to join the circus. Fascinating series about the Big Apple Circus featuring the founders,performers from generations of "circus people" and those trying to become part of the circus. I wish I had some of their talents. It made me want to run away from home and become part of this traveling group of talented artists.
Title: Circus

reviewText: Really gives you a behind the scenes view of what goes on to put on a cirus.  I enjoyed it quite a lot.
Title: Circus

reviewText: Great show for seeing the behind the scenes of a real circus.
Title: Circus
